snippet: The two days of legislative dysfunction over a bill to address the border crisis was remarkable even for congressional Republicans.
abstract: Editorial argues that Congressional dysfunction reached new heights during two days in which both the House and the Senate failed to approve passable immigration reform, even as border crisis mounts and thousands continue to suffer; laments nihilism on the part of Congressional Republicans that has resulted in power vacuum; calls on Pres Obama to do whatever is in his power until lawmakers return to Washington in September.
lead_paragraph: The two days of legislative dysfunction over a bill to address the border crisis was remarkable even for congressional Republicans.
